early.description: Born in a city already showing signs of a mysterious illness, your earliest memories are of overcrowded hospitals and whispered fears.
At age six, you helped your family by running errands, navigating through quarantined zones.
You learned basic first aid by observing overworked medical staff, showcasing your quick learning ability.
An encounter with enforcers imposing lockdowns taught you the importance of discretion and agility.
You developed a network of safe routes to avoid checkpoints and infected areas.
Witnessing the collapse of public services instilled in you a sense of self-reliance.
You customized a makeshift mask and protective gear from available materials.
An older survivor taught you about identifying symptoms and avoiding infection.
You formed a bond with another child survivor, sharing knowledge and resources.
A close call with infected individuals sharpened your reflexes and instincts.
You began studying medical texts scavenged from abandoned clinics.
An illness in your family tested your resolve and ingenuity in finding medicine.
You discovered a hidden cache of medical supplies, improving your situation temporarily.
A family member disappeared during chaos, prompting you to become more self-reliant.
You started experimenting with herbal remedies, enhancing your knowledge.
An encounter with corporate agents hoarding supplies sparked your distrust.
You developed a skill for moving unnoticed through dangerous areas.

mid.description: You joined a group of survivors, pooling resources and knowledge to stay healthy.
A conflict with another survivor over scarce medicine tested your wits and resolve.
You infiltrated a quarantined zone to obtain vital supplies, showcasing stealth and courage.
An opportunity to join a corporate-run safe zone arose, challenging your trust.
You began mentoring younger survivors, teaching them how to avoid infection.
A personal loss due to the pandemic made you question your path.
You discovered evidence of corporate exploitation during the crisis, sparking anger.
A romantic relationship complicated your survival priorities.
You faced ethical choices when deciding who to help with limited resources.
An injury forced you to adapt your methods, relying more on intelligence than physical ability.

late.description: Elevated to a leadership role among survivors, you coordinated efforts to stay healthy.
A major outbreak threatened your group's existence, requiring decisive action.
You uncovered a plan that could lead to a cure, prompting difficult choices.
Faced with a moral dilemma, you had to choose between personal safety and the greater good.
An opportunity to expose corporate malfeasance challenged your priorities.
You exposed a traitor within your group, preventing further harm.
A personal tragedy prompted deep reflection on your life's direction.
You began to suffer from the psychological effects of prolonged crisis.
A movement to find a permanent safe haven gained momentum, and you had to decide your role.
You mentored a young survivor, hoping to pass on your knowledge.
Conditions worsened, making survival increasingly difficult.
You authored a journal documenting survival techniques and experiences during the pandemic.
An external threat, such as hostile groups or environmental hazards, endangered your group.
You faced a critical decision when offered a chance to escape at the expense of others.
An unexpected alliance offered new possibilities but also new risks.
You considered the legacy you would leave and how to effect lasting change.
A technological advancement changed the dynamics of the pandemic, forcing you to adapt.
